passages.text: August 28, 2025 06:57 AM GMT
Strengthens our thesis Impact to our thesis
In-line Financial results versus consensus
Modest revision lower Direction of next 12-month consensus EPS
Source: Company data, Morgan Stanley Research

Revenue down \(4.3\%\) y/y in cc, which is c. 1pp better than consensus  Adj. EBITDA of CHF 68.6m, in-line with consensus  Combined LfL FY25 guidance with Crayon indicates flat revenue and adj. EBITDA margin \(>20\%\)  Expectations for merger synergies unchanged, but CHF 11m running cost synergies already achieved  We expect the shares to underperform by MSD % today.

In- line quarter but guidance will weigh. Overall an in- line quarter on both revenue and adj. EBITDA. As expected, revenue continued to decline y/y in 2Q; coming in at - \(4.3\%\) in cc terms. This continues to be driven by NORAM (- 29.7% y/y); however, all other geographies also continued to see negative growth, except for APAC which was up +11.2%. While new leadership is already in place in NORAM and turnaround measures to resolve the GTM issues are being implemented, management have taken a more prudent view on the outlook for 2H. Citing risks around a successful turnaround as well as current macro- uncertainty, management no longer expect a steep 2H acceleration back to double digit growth (as implied under the previous 2- \(4\%\) guidance range). Now, on a- combined LfL basis with Crayon, growth is expected by be flat in cc terms in 2025 (vs. - 3.1% delivered by the combined company in 1H25). We think this implies a return to low- to- mid single digit y/y growth in 2H (both for SoftwareOne standard one and the combined company), which we think is more aligned with current consensus expectations for SoftwareOne, but likely significantly below expectations for Crayon (which guided to 15 to 20% gross profit growth in FY25). We see further room for disappointment on the adj. EBITDA margin guidance, which is now expected to be above 20% on a combined basis (i.e. stable vs. the 20% in 2024 on a combined basis). We estimate that this is \(\sim 3\) pps lower than what was implied by the combined previous standalone guidance ranges provided by both SoftwareOne and Crayon. Overall despite an in- line 2Q, we think the lowered FY25 guidance will be a negative for the shares today (we note that the company will provide guidance for FY26 as well as a mid- term targets with their FY25 results). We see the shares down mid to high single digit % today.
1H25 revenues in line with consensus expectations. 1H25 revenue declined c. 5%
MORGAN STANLEY & CO. INTERNATIONAL PLC+
Matias Rodriguez Florez- Estrada

ex-FX y/y, coming in broadly in line with street. The Software & Cloud Marketplace division declined c. 11% y/y ex-FX – driven by weakness in the Microsoft transactional business – in line with consensus. Within Software & Cloud Marketplace, Microsoft gross billings declined 2% ex-FX y/y, as Microsoft took certain large customers direct in 2Q25 and given measures by SWON to pivot towards "more profitable business given incentive reductions on enterprise agreements." Software & Cloud Services grew 2.4% y/y ex-FX, driven mostly by Application Services and Digital Workplace, in line with street expectations. The company noted its continued focus on cross-selling with 75% of LTM revenues generated by c. 16.2k clients purchasing software and services (vs. 16.1k y/y). Essentials (formerly xSimples) revenues increased 3% y/y ex-FX in 1H25 as clients continue to transition to the CSP model.

1H25 EBITDA slightly above street. 1H25 adjusted EBITDA margin of 23.5% came in 1% above consensus, supported by the cost reduction program complete in 1Q25. Group adjusted EBITDA declined c. 3% y/y ex-FX, driven by a lower contribution margin in the Software & Cloud Marketplace division. 1H25 Software & Cloud Marketplace adj. EBITDA margin increased 320bps y/y to 53.4% while 1H25 Software & Cloud Services margin rose c. 130bps y/y to 8.6% - driven by a higher contribution margin and lower SG&A expenses. Group total EBITDA adjustments amounted to CHF 29.7m in 1H25 vs. CHF 39.7m in 1H24.

Commentary on merger synergies unchanged. On the whole, expected synergies from the Crayon merger are unchanged, with the company still expecting CHF 80- 100M of running cost synergies and "significant" revenue synergies to be reached by end- 2026. We are encouraged by the fact that CHF 11m of the run- rate cost synergies are already achieved by end- August 2025, indicating that good progress is being made on what we see as broadly ambitious targets (see our note on the merger for more detail: Drawing Synergies). We will be watching further progress here throughout 2H25.
Exhibit 1: SoftwareOne results table

We value SoftwareOne on a c. \(6.6\%\) 2026e Base case adjusted FCFF/EV yield (in- line with reseller peers), which we think is appropriate given the risks around successful execution of the turnaround in GTM strategy and the Crayon merger.
- Successful turnaround of GTM strategy- Crayon synergies meet or exceed expectations- Growth accelerating ahead of mid-term targets, driven by cross-selling in Solutions & Services

- GTM turnaround fails to materialise- Crayon synergies materially below expectations- Reliance on Microsoft and any changes to partnership terms- Higher services growth results in downside risk to mid-term margin guide

Overweight (O). The stock's total return is expected to exceed the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Equal-weight (E). The stock's total return is expected to be in line with the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Not-Rated (NR). Currently the analyst does not have adequate conviction about the stock's total return relative to the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.

Underweight (U). The stock's total return is expected to be below the average total return of the analyst's industry (or industry team's) coverage universe, on a risk-adjusted basis, over the next 12- 18 months.
Unless otherwise specified, the time frame for price targets included in Morgan Stanley Research is 12 to 18 months.
Attractive (A): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be attractive vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below.

In- Line (I): The analyst expects the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months to be in line with the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Cautious (C): The analyst views the performance of his or her industry coverage universe over the next 12- 18 months with caution vs. the relevant broad market benchmark, as indicated below. Benchmarks for each region are as follows: North America - S&P 500; Latin America - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI Latin America Index; Europe - MSCI Europe; Japan - TOPIX; Asia - relevant MSCI country index or MSCI sub- regional index or MSCI AC Asia Pacific ex Japan Index.
